caption: Digital Users and Households
trend_summary: Verified users grew from 39 million in 2Q20 to 46 million in 2Q23, while active users grew from 52 million to 57 million over the same period. Household adoption increased from 68% in 2Q20 to 74% in 2Q23.

caption: Digital Channel Usage
trend_summary: Total digital channel usage has increased from 2,346 million in 2Q20 to 3,148 million in 2Q23. Digital appointments also rose from 665 thousand to 871 thousand during this period.

caption: Digital Sales
trend_summary: Digital unit sales have risen from 1,089 thousand in 2Q20 to 1,770 thousand in 2Q23. Digital sales as a percentage of total sales have increased from 47% to 51% over the same timeframe.

caption: Erica® Active Users and Interactions (MM)
trend_summary: Erica® active users increased from 6.5 million in 2Q20 to 18.2 million in 2Q23. Erica® interactions grew significantly from 37.2 million to 166.5 million during the same period.

caption: Person-to-Person Payments (Zelle®)
trend_summary: Zelle transactions increased from 117 million in 2Q20 to 303 million in 2Q23, with the corresponding transaction volume growing from $32 billion to $91 billion. Zelle users also grew from 11.3 million to 20.3 million over the same period.

caption: Checks vs. Zelle® Sent Transactions (MM)
trend_summary: Zelle® sent transactions have surged from 79 million in 2Q20 to 197 million in 2Q23, while checks written have declined from 130 million to 111 million over the same period.

caption: Digital Households / Relationships
trend_summary: Digital households/relationships increased from 643,000 in 2Q20 to 718,000 in 2Q23. Digital adoption percentage also rose from 77% to 83% during this period.

caption: Digital Channel Adoption
trend_summary: Online adoption remained stable at 75-76% from 2Q20 to 2Q23, while mobile adoption increased from 49% to 59% in the same period.

caption: eDelivery
trend_summary: The percentage of clients using eDelivery grew steadily from 66% in 2Q20 to 78% in 2Q23.

caption: Erica® Interactions (MM)
trend_summary: Erica® interactions increased significantly from 0.4 million in 2Q20 to 2.7 million in 2Q23.

caption: Person-to-Person Payments (Zelle®)
trend_summary: Zelle® transactions grew from 0.8 million in 2Q20 to 3.0 million in 2Q23, with the corresponding volume increasing from $0.4 billion to $1.8 billion.

caption: Check Deposits
trend_summary: Automated check deposits (as a percentage of total) increased slightly from 72% in 2Q20 to 74% in 2Q23. Physical check deposits decreased from 1.5 million in 2Q20 to 1.3 million in 2Q23.

caption: Client Digital Adoption %
trend_summary: Client digital adoption remained high and stable, at 75% in 2Q21, 76% in 2Q22, and 75% in 2Q23.

caption: CashPro® App Sign-ins (K)
trend_summary: CashPro® App sign-ins have steadily increased from 247,000 in 2Q20 to 803,000 in 2Q23, showing strong growth in mobile engagement.

caption: CashPro® App Payments
trend_summary: The volume of CashPro® App payments grew from 0.9 million in 2Q20 to 3.5 million in 2Q23, while the value increased significantly from $48 billion to $201 billion over the same period.

caption: CashPro® Proactive Alerts & Insights (MM)
trend_summary: The number of CashPro® proactive alerts and insights increased from 12.7 million in 2Q20 to 18.0 million in 2Q23.

caption: Global Payments to Digital Wallets (K)
trend_summary: Global payments to digital wallets peaked in 2Q21 at 403,000 and have since settled at 400,000 in 2Q23, after a low of 315,000 in 2Q20.

caption: Credit Monitoring Documents Uploaded Digitally (%)
trend_summary: The percentage of credit monitoring documents uploaded digitally has more than doubled, increasing from 17% in 2Q20 to 39% in 2Q23.

caption: Quarterly Operating Leverage
trend_summary: Operating leverage has shown a positive trend since 3Q21, peaking at 12% in 3Q21 and standing at 6% in 2Q23. This follows a period of negative or low leverage from 1Q19 to 2Q21.

caption: Total Loans and Leases ($B)
trend_summary: Total loans and leases have shown modest growth, increasing from $1,015B in 2Q22 to $1,047B in 2Q23, a 3% year-over-year increase.

caption: Total Loans and Leases in All Other ($B)
trend_summary: Total loans and leases in 'All Other' have decreased from $15B in 2Q22 to $10B in 2Q23, a 32% year-over-year decline. The decrease is mainly driven by residential mortgages.

caption: Loans and Leases in Business Segments ($B)
trend_summary: Total loans and leases in business segments grew 4% year-over-year to $1,037B in 2Q23. Global Markets saw the highest growth at 12%, while Consumer Banking grew 6% and GWIM remained flat.

caption: Total Loans and Leases by Portfolio ($B)
trend_summary: Total loans and leases by portfolio show a slight increase, with commercial loans growing from $569B in 2Q22 to $593B in 2Q23, and consumer loans growing from $446B to $454B in the same period.

caption: Total Corporation ($B)
trend_summary: Total corporation deposits decreased from $1,910B on 03/31/23 to $1,877B on 06/30/23. The decline was seen in both interest-bearing and noninterest-bearing deposits.

caption: Consumer Banking ($B)
trend_summary: Consumer banking deposits decreased from $1,045B on 03/31/23 to $1,004B on 06/30/23, primarily driven by a decline in checking deposits.

caption: GWIM ($B)
trend_summary: GWIM deposits saw a slight decrease from $301B on 03/31/23 to $293B on 06/30/23, with declines in both bank and sweep deposits.

caption: Global Banking ($B)
trend_summary: Global banking deposits remained relatively stable, slightly decreasing from $496B on 03/31/23 to $493B on 06/30/23.

caption: Total Corporation ($B)
trend_summary: Total average deposits declined from $2,012B in 4Q19 to $1,875B in 2Q23, a 1% decrease quarter-over-quarter. Noninterest-bearing deposits increased 1% QoQ, while interest-bearing deposits decreased 5% QoQ.

caption: Consumer Banking ($B)
trend_summary: Consumer banking average deposits decreased 2% quarter-over-quarter to $1,006B in 2Q23. Both checking and non-checking deposits saw a 2% QoQ decline.

caption: GWIM ($B)
trend_summary: GWIM average deposits decreased 6% quarter-over-quarter to $295B in 2Q23. The decline was driven by a 16% QoQ decrease in sweep deposits.

caption: Global Banking ($B)
trend_summary: Global banking average deposits increased 1% quarter-over-quarter to $498B in 2Q23, driven by a 13% QoQ increase in interest-bearing deposits.

caption: Deposits in Excess of Loans (EOP, $B)
trend_summary: Deposits in excess of loans peaked in 2Q22 at $954B and stood at $826B in 2Q23. The gap between total deposits and loans has been narrowing since 2Q22.

caption: Cash and Securities Portfolios ($B)
trend_summary: The cash and securities portfolio composition shifted in 2Q23, with cash and cash equivalents increasing significantly to $374B, while HTM and AFS securities decreased to $614B and $142B respectively.

caption: Cash & Securities Yield and Deposit Rates
trend_summary: The cash & securities yield increased to 3.19% in 2Q23, while the total deposit rate paid also rose to 1.24%. The spread between the two, representing the yield on cash & securities vs. the deposit rate, has widened significantly in the last year.

caption: Net Interest Income (FTE, $B)
trend_summary: Net interest income (GAAP) was $14.2B in 2Q23, slightly down from $14.4B in 1Q23 but up from $12.4B in 2Q22. FTE Adjusted NII shows a similar trend, at $14.3B in 2Q23.

caption: Net Interest Yield (FTE)
trend_summary: The reported net interest yield was 2.06% in 2Q23, down from 2.20% in 1Q23. The net interest yield excluding Global Markets was 2.65% in 2Q23, also down from its peak of 2.85% in 1Q23.

caption: Total Noninterest Expense ($B)
trend_summary: Total noninterest expense was $16.0B in 2Q23, down slightly from $16.2B in 1Q23 but up from $15.3B in 2Q22. The 'Other' expense category has increased compared to the previous year, while 'Compensation and benefits' also rose year-over-year.

caption: Efficiency Ratio
trend_summary: The efficiency ratio was 64% in 2Q23, up from 62% in 1Q23 but down from 67% in 2Q22, showing an overall improvement in efficiency year-over-year.

caption: Net Charge-offs ($MM)
trend_summary: Net charge-offs increased to $869MM in 2Q23 from $571MM in 2Q22. The net charge-off ratio also increased from 0.23% to 0.33% over the same period, showing a rising trend.

caption: Provision for Credit Losses ($MM)
trend_summary: Provision for credit losses has increased significantly from $523MM in 2Q22 to $1,125MM in 2Q23, indicating a more cautious outlook on credit quality.

caption: Consumer Net Charge-offs ($MM)
trend_summary: Consumer net charge-offs rose to $720MM in 2Q23 from $525MM in 2Q22, with the consumer NCO ratio increasing from 0.47% to 0.64%. The increase is primarily driven by credit card charge-offs.

caption: Commercial Net Charge-offs ($MM)
trend_summary: Commercial net charge-offs increased to $149MM in 2Q23 from $46MM in 2Q22. The commercial NCO ratio also rose from 0.03% to 0.10% over the same period, largely due to commercial real estate.

caption: Total Revenue ($B)
trend_summary: Total revenue decreased slightly to $10.5B in 2Q23 from $10.7B in 1Q23, but increased from $9.1B in 2Q22. Net interest income has been the main driver of revenue growth over the past year.

caption: Total Expense ($B) and Efficiency
trend_summary: Total expense remained flat at $5.5B in 2Q23 compared to 1Q23, but up from $5.0B in 2Q22. The efficiency ratio improved to 52% in 2Q23 from 54% in 2Q22.

caption: Average Deposits ($B)
trend_summary: Average deposits have shown a declining trend, from $1,078B in 2Q22 to $1,006B in 2Q23, with both checking and other deposits decreasing.

caption: Average Loans and Leases ($B)
trend_summary: Average loans and leases increased from $290B in 2Q22 to $307B in 2Q23, driven by growth in consumer credit card, vehicle lending, and home equity, while residential mortgage and small business/other loans remained relatively stable.

caption: Consumer Investment Assets ($B) and Accounts (MM)
trend_summary: Consumer investment assets grew from $315B in 2Q22 to $387B in 2Q23, and the number of accounts increased from 3.4 million to 3.7 million over the same period.

caption: Consumer Credit Card New Accounts (K)
trend_summary: New credit card accounts were 1,137K in 2Q23, down from 1,255K in 3Q22 but up from 1,068K in 2Q22.

caption: Consumer Vehicle Lending New Originations ($B)
trend_summary: New vehicle lending originations were $6.8B in 2Q23, slightly down from $7.0B in 1Q23 and $7.1B in 2Q22.

caption: Residential Mortgage New Originations ($B)
trend_summary: New residential mortgage originations increased to $5.9B in 2Q23 from $3.9B in 1Q23, but are significantly lower than the $14.5B in 2Q22.

caption: Home Equity New Originations ($B)
trend_summary: New home equity originations have remained stable, at $2.5B in 2Q23, consistent with $2.5B in 2Q22 and slightly down from $2.6B in 1Q23.

caption: Average Deposits ($B)
trend_summary: Average deposits have consistently declined from $364B in 2Q22 to $295B in 2Q23.

caption: Average Loans and Leases ($B)
trend_summary: Average loans and leases remained relatively flat, standing at $219B in 2Q23, the same as 2Q22, with minor fluctuations in between. The composition between custom lending and securities-based lending has also been stable.

caption: Total Revenue ($B)
trend_summary: Total revenue has been stable, around $5.2B to $5.4B over the past five quarters. In 2Q23, it was $5.2B, with net interest income contributing $2.9B.

caption: Client Balances ($B)
trend_summary: Total client balances grew from $3,367B in 2Q22 to $3,635B in 2Q23, driven by increases in AUM and Brokerage/Other balances, while deposits and loans/leases saw slight decreases.

caption: Average Deposits ($B)
trend_summary: Average deposits have slightly decreased from $509B in 2Q22 to $498B in 2Q23. The proportion of interest-bearing deposits has increased from 28% to 42% over the same period.

caption: Average Loans and Leases ($B)
trend_summary: Average loans and leases have remained stable, increasing slightly from $377B in 2Q22 to $383B in 2Q23. The composition of loans across commercial, corporate, and business banking has been consistent.

caption: Total Revenue ($B)
trend_summary: Total revenue has grown significantly from $5.0B in 2Q22 to $6.5B in 2Q23, primarily driven by an increase in net interest income from $2.6B to $3.7B.

caption: Total Corporation IB Fees ($MM)
trend_summary: Total corporate IB fees increased to $1,212MM in 2Q23 from $1,128MM in 2Q22, with a notable increase in Debt fees in the most recent quarter.

caption: 2023 YTD Global Markets Revenue Mix (excl. net DVA)
trend_summary: For 2023 YTD, 61% of Global Markets revenue came from U.S./Canada, with the remaining 39% from international sources.

caption: 2023 YTD Total FICC S&T Revenue Mix (excl. net DVA)
trend_summary: For 2023 YTD, the FICC sales and trading revenue mix was 57% from Macro products and 43% from Credit/Other products.

caption: Total Sales and Trading Revenue (excl. net DVA) ($B)
trend_summary: YTD sales and trading revenue was $9.4B in 2023, an increase from previous years, driven by strong performance in FICC which reached $6.2B.

caption: Average Trading-Related Assets ($B) and VaR ($MM)
trend_summary: Average trading-related assets have increased to $624B YTD in 2023 from $485B in 2020, while Average VaR has decreased from $65MM to $93MM over the same period, after peaking at $99MM in 2022.

caption: Payment Spend ($ Volume) and YoY % Growth
trend_summary: Total consumer payment spend has grown from $1.4T in 2020 to $2.1T in 2023 YTD, with year-over-year growth moderating from 25% in 2021 to 5% in 2023.

caption: Payment Spend ($ and Transaction Volume) Quarterly YoY % Growth
trend_summary: Quarterly year-over-year growth in both payment volume and transaction number has been trending downwards since a peak in early 2021, settling at 4% for volume and 2% for transactions in 2Q23.

caption: 2023 YTD Credit and Debit YoY % Growth
trend_summary: Year-to-date in 2023, credit and debit spending shows varied year-over-year growth across categories. Travel & Entertainment saw strong growth (10%), while Gas spending declined (-11%). Overall, spend was up 4% and transactions up 5%.

caption: 2023 YTD YoY Change in Payment Transaction Volume
trend_summary: For 2023 YTD, the largest portion of payment volume (78%) is from Credit/Debit, which grew 5% YoY. P2P/P2B transactions grew the most at 15% YoY and represent 7% of the volume.

caption: Commercial Real Estate as a Percent of:
trend_summary: Commercial Real Estate as a percentage of total commercial loans has decreased from 21.2% in 4Q09 to 12.5% in 2Q23. As a percentage of total loans and leases, it has decreased from 7.1% to 6.9% in the same period.

caption: Geographic Distribution ($B)
trend_summary: The ~$74B Commercial Real Estate portfolio is geographically diversified, with the largest concentrations in the Northeast (22%), Southeast (19%), and Midsouth (19%).

caption: Distribution by Property Type ($B)
trend_summary: The ~$74B Commercial Real Estate portfolio is diversified by property type, with the largest exposures to Office (25%), Industrial/Warehouse (19%), and Multi-family rental (19%).

caption: Office Portfolio Scheduled Maturities ($B)
trend_summary: The office portfolio has scheduled maturities of $2.8B in 2H23, $6.3B in 2024, $3.0B in 2025, and $6.0B in 2026 and beyond.
